alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 5:28AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kay, northwestern Noble, Grant and northeastern Garfield Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 528 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Shidler to 3 miles northeast of Tonkawa to 3 miles southeast of Medford. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Blackwell, Tonkawa, Medford, Newkirk, Pond Creek, Lamont, Kaw City, Marland, Braman, Hunter, Deer Creek, Kildare, Jefferson, Renfrow, Chilocco, Kaw Lake, Hardy, Nardin and Blackwell Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 205 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
